images.title: Ajanta Caves
images.desc: Ancient Buddhist masterpieces that shaped Indian classical art & architecture.

images.title: Bodh Gaya
images.desc: Sacred site where Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree.

images.title: Ellora Caves
images.desc: A harmony of Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain rock-cut temple architecture.

images.title: Khajuraho
images.desc: Renowned for its erotic sculptures and stunning Nagara-style temples.

images.title: Taj Mahal
images.desc: A timeless symbol of love and Mughal architectural brilliance.

images.title: Black Buck
images.desc: Graceful antelope with spiral horns, known for speed and leaping in grasslands.

images.title: Chinkara
images.desc: A shy Indian gazelle, commonly found in deserts and scrub forests across India.

images.title: Elephant
images.desc: Gentle giants of the forest, revered in Indian culture and religious traditions.

images.title: Asiatic Lion
images.desc: Endangered species, found only in India’s Gir Forest with a majestic presence.

images.title: Indian Rhinoceros
images.desc: One-horned rhino, primarily found in Assam, known for its armor-like skin.

images.title: Snow Leopard
images.desc: Elusive mountain predator of the Himalayas, adapted to icy terrain and cold climate.

images.title: Bengal Tiger
images.desc: India’s national animal, powerful and iconic predator of the Indian jungles.

images.title: Dussehra
images.desc: Celebrates the victory of good over evil, symbolized by Lord Rama's triumph over Ravana.

images.title: Diwali
images.desc: The festival of lights, symbolizing the return of Lord Rama to Ayodhya and the triumph of light over darkness.

images.title: Durga Puja
images.desc: Honors Goddess Durga’s victory over the buffalo demon Mahishasura, celebrating feminine power.

images.title: Ganesh Chaturthi
images.desc: Marks the birth of Lord Ganesha, celebrated with grand processions and idol immersions.

images.title: Holi
images.desc: The festival of colors, symbolizing the arrival of spring and the victory of good over evil.

images.title: Janmashtami
images.desc: Celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna with fasting, devotional singing, and midnight celebrations.

images.title: Kumbh Mela
images.desc: A major pilgrimage and spiritual gathering held at sacred rivers across India.

images.title: Makar Sankranti
images.desc: Harvest festival marking the sun’s transition into Capricorn, celebrated with kite flying and sweets.

images.title: Navratri
images.desc: Nine-night festival honoring Goddess Durga, featuring dance, fasting, and devotion.

images.title: Raksha Bandhan
images.desc: Celebrates the bond between brothers and sisters with the tying of a protective thread.

images.title: Bamboo Basketry
images.desc: Intricately handwoven baskets made from bamboo, reflecting sustainable Indian craftsmanship.

images.title: Artisan Crafting
images.desc: Skilled artisans bring traditional Indian crafts to life through generations of heritage.

images.title: Embroidery
images.desc: Elaborate needlework adorning fabrics with regional styles like Phulkari, Kantha, and Zardozi.

images.title: Metal Craft
images.desc: Traditional Indian metalwork in brass, copper, and silver—used in idols, utensils, and decor.

images.title: Pattachitra Art
images.desc: Ancient scroll painting from Odisha and Bengal, known for its intricate details and mythological themes.

images.title: Pottery
images.desc: From terracotta to blue pottery, Indian pottery showcases both utility and aesthetic beauty.

images.title: Wooden Textile Block
images.desc: Hand-carved wooden blocks used in traditional Indian textile printing, especially in Rajasthan.

images.title: Bharatanatyam
images.desc: Originating in Tamil Nadu, it’s one of the oldest classical dance forms known for grace and expression.

images.title: Kathak
images.desc: A North Indian classical dance form that blends storytelling with intricate footwork and spins.

images.title: Kathakali
images.desc: A vibrant dance-drama from Kerala, known for elaborate costumes and expressive gestures.

images.title: Kuchipudi
images.desc: A classical dance from Andhra Pradesh, combining fast rhythms with dramatic storytelling.

images.title: Manipuri
images.desc: A graceful dance form from Manipur, deeply rooted in Vaishnavism and characterized by gentle movements.

images.title: Odissi
images.desc: A dance form from Odisha, known for its lyrical movement and sculptural poses.
